utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Patuxent River Naval Air Station near D.C. was commissioned in 1943 by John McCain's grandfather." I'm thinking of going hang gliding.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Pax river is, like, completely flat. I think that's why they tested the V-22 Osprey there. I like naval stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like their oranges and lint. What looks like kidney disease, but isn't? And where's Chase?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Root canal and Berger's. The first one was regarding Chase. Root canal, if done correctly, doesn't look like kidney disease.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Got a case for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Smells funny.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Patient had an idiopathic anaphylactic reaction. It stumped two E.R. docs and an immunologist from Johns Hopkins.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient went from asymptomatic to fried kidneys in less than a year. Stumped three internists and a department chair from Harvard.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 14-year-old girl, intermittent attacks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Four-year-old boy, consistently at death's door.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: This patient died five years ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't say which side of the door he was on. The fact that he's dead makes it more interesting. Four-year-olds do not die of Berger's.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I thought it was relevant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Death is a consequence, not a symptom. If it's not a symptom, it's not relevant.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Shouldn't we be trying to maximize what we can save here? 14-year-old, your freedom, our asses?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right… save your asses.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: She was in a car accident when she was two. She only had minor injuries, but her father died.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That was 12 years ago. You think that's pertinent?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, I think it's sad. She got sick in the middle of her 14th birthday party. Which is sad and pertinent. Maybe she was opening a present that triggered the reaction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Where's House?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pissing contest with Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Last thing she ate was strawberry cake, but allergy tests for everything were negative.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Do you like your dentist? I'm still going to my pediatric one. What's your dentist's name?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Williams.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What if it's not an allergic reaction? Hereditary angioedema or systemic mastocytosis could mimic anaphylaxis.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're not sure of his name? You just saw him this morning.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His assistant's name is Angie. Her home number is…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Normal complement studies. No skin lesions.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You had a manicure. This is fresh! You weren't at the dentist. Why would you lie about that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: To avoid having this conversation.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Elevated BP. What about pheochromocytoma?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or an anaphylactoid reaction, which could be triggered by certain opioids.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You've had your hair cut three times since I've met you. You can't be embarrassed about a manicure. There's gotta be a deeper reason.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did House give you homework?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: She's not on any meds.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Haven't you heard? Everybody lies.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And the tox screen was clean.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Feel free to jump in at any time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We'll check catecholamines for pheo and run an expanded opioid panel. You see what the patient says about drug use when her mother's out of the room.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: No, never.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Nobody's here to bust you, Iris. We just need to know if…

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: No, I already told you. I just take vitamin C sometimes.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What exactly were you doing when you had your reaction?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Opening a birthday present. The Magic 8 Ball. The joke gift, not the cocaine. Is that it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Certain drugs could explain her reaction.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: What kind of drugs?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What kind did you have in mind?

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Iris has always been a moody girl. And now that she's a teenager, it's gotten worse. So for the past few months I've been… giving something to relax her. Diazepam. I tell her it's vitamin C. Being normal is very important to Iris. She couldn't handle the thought of being on meds.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Anti-anxiety medications would explain it. If we keep her off, she'll be moody, but healthy. Or it's something else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need to DDX a patient with you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I thought you had a team for that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: According to Foreman, they're only for DDXing people who are still alive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have a dead patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bigotry is boring when we add modifiers. I don't see creed, color, pulse.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Foreman will find out you're taking this case and he'll bust you. But you know that, which means… you want to go back to jail… because it's the one place you're unable to indulge your self-destructive habits.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it's much more likely that I'm taking this case because I miss showering with Cro-Magnons than that I actually happen to find it interesting. Four-year-old kid. His kidneys died, they transfused. His lungs died. He died.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you seen Bride of the Monster? I just got the Ed Wood box set.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if the chicken was the egg? What if the lung involvement came first?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't really care about the movie. I just don't want to indulge your…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lupus.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because this is a bad idea, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the kid had a rash or some circulation issue… Damn! I just realized I'm late for my anger management class.

utterance.speaker: Gene
utterance.content: Traffic, for sure.

utterance.speaker: Dixon
utterance.content: Taxes.

utterance.speaker: Gene
utterance.content: Definitely taxes.

utterance.speaker: Lena
utterance.content: Spoiled grandchildren.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Platitudes.

utterance.speaker: Gene
utterance.content: Any others?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I lose my temper when someone suggests that a handful of pop-psych catch phrases can control our most seminal, intractable, and natural reaction to a dead child. Am I right, Emory?

utterance.speaker: Gene
utterance.content: I don't think Emory wants to share right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They blew it, didn't they? They missed your son's rash. A faint one, on his cheek.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: He didn't have a rash. I think we should talk about Lena's grandchildren.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're alive. Was he sensitive to sunlight?

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Gene
utterance.content: Greg…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cold fingers and toes?

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wegener's granulomatosis. I need to examine your son.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: You're a bit late for that… you ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: With you and your wife's consent, we can get an exhumation order. Find out what killed him.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: Ex-wife. And you'll never get her consent. She's moved on… new hub, new kid. She wants nothing to do with Drew's death. Or me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're angry because your kid died. More than that, because you don't have an answer. People need answers.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: He's in a crypt at St. Jude's Cemetery.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You feeling any pain or cramping here?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: A bit. But not just there, um… here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Breast tenderness. Have you been having regular periods, Iris?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think we should run a pregnancy test.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Iris isn't sexually active. She doesn't even have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Pregnancy would explain all of her symptoms. Can even cause some unpredictable allergic reactions.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: How can I be pregnant if I've never even had sex?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We just need a drop of blood.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: My… my arms. I can't feel my arms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At this rate, I'm gonna need to pick out a plot for myself.

utterance.speaker: Milton
utterance.content: Thanks to your generous donation, you have all morning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: More like 13 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Milton
utterance.content: Before we proceed any further, doctor, I'd like inquire as to exactly what procedure you intend to perform on the remains.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you ever heard of the North American Man/Dead Boy Love Association?

utterance.speaker: Milton
utterance.content: I consider these grounds to be a holy place, and I would ask you to observe them with due decorum.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you're taking bribes to plunder graves, and I need to show respect. I think they got the cause of death wrong. And if I find a hole in the cartilage of his nose, right about here, then it means I'm right.

utterance.speaker: Milton
utterance.content: Please be respectful.

utterance.speaker: Milton
utterance.content: I prepared the sarcophagus for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you, Igor.

utterance.speaker: Milton
utterance.content: It's Milton.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You owe me a new pair of pants.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: She is pregnant. Test came back positive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So… she lost the use of her arms and her innocence. A vengeful God? Or…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cerebral tumor.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Vasculitis.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: MS.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I gather from the silence that Chase isn't there.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope, I'm here. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Nowhere"… he said cryptically. I assume you concur with the diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Even though there are three diagnoses? And MS and vasculitis usually get better with pregnancy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, I was saying I agreed with the other one.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's had his eyebrows waxed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I met a woman who likes her men well groomed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All over? I assume, from the silence, that Chase has had a Brazilian.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ouch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Question is… is this really about a woman? Or is it about something more profound?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Another question is, could the paresthesia be caused by an STD? HIV-related mononeuritis multiplex.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I gather from the silence that either you all agree with Chase or you're just staring at his emasculated brow. In either case, test for HIV and do an MRI to rule out tumors. And check Chase for testosterone.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Blood work was negative for HIV. All the money's on tumor.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How was the Brazilian?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It was fine. Hurt a bit.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What about House's theory? Why'd you really do it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 'Cause I'm vain and shallow.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And you weren't before?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The girl I was seeing wasn't. There's nothing profound here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No tumor, either. It's not her brain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everything looks good.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: My arm, it's…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Still nothing?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: No, now they're sore.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Paresthesia's gone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could the bruising be caused by a physical trauma?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You think she fell out of bed, repeatedly?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: A blood disorder. Maybe thrombocytopenia.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: A vitamin K deficiency or scurvy could explain bleeding problems, and pregnancy could exacerbate it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Boys, do a home search. Girls, do lab tests. I'm pretty sure that's not sexist.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where have you been?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Picking up dry cleaning. Filling up the tank. Violating the dead. If you don't believe me, call the monitoring company.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I did. Unfortunately, the Patuxent River Naval Air Station was GPS testing and disrupted the signal, at the exact same 45 minutes you weren't here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if I'd known I had 45 minutes of freedom, I'd have gone hang gliding.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I admire the creativity. But what happens when the stunt doesn't work? Think you're gonna have to pay off a bet? Think I'm gonna triple your clinic hours? I'm gonna call your P.O., and you're gonna go back to jail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There are Mees' lines on his fingernails, so now I'm thinking heavy metal poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're an addict. And I'm an idiot for thinking that your addictions were limited to pills, anti-social behavior, and sarcasm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. Vicodin repeating on me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're also addicted to puzzles. You show all the classic behaviors. Lying, neglecting responsibilities, and you can't stop, no matter how devastating the consequences.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Working on a medical case is not a parole violation. It's my job description.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your job description is doing what Foreman tells you to do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Never mind Bride of the Monster. You need to watch Norma Rae.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Before we get started, I just want to thank you all for agreeing to relocate. Um, I had an appointment in this part of town, and I obviously didn't want to miss this meeting. But, uh, thank you. I'm buying. Not literally. Hey, Emory, should we, uh, powder our noses?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, did you know your ex-wife still lives right behind this place?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She finishes work at 4:00. Picks up her new kid at 4:15. Gives us about 20 minutes. I made some calls. It's amazing what people will tell you if you ask rudely enough. Was that table here? Some kinds of pressure-treated wood can contain arsenic.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: We shouldn't be here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We don't have a choice. This is the only way you're gonna get your answer. Does your ex leave a spare key anywhere?

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: How did he look?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Peaceful.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Vitamin K deficiency's a bust. Fridge has more spinach and broccoli than a farmer's market. The Brazilian… you said it hurt "a bit."

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You've had one?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: More than one, and you haven't. They hurt all your bits. That's my dark secret. What's yours?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I had the nails and eyebrows done, but that's it. I just needed to create a distraction, though. I met a TV producer at a dinner. She asked me to appear on the medical segment. Screen tested it yesterday and shot it today.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're a TV doctor?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's a one-off.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When's it air?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two hours ago. Otherwise, I'd still be lying.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is what she was opening when she had her attack. Will anyone believe Chase is an actual doctor? "Don't count on it."

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She does have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Love letters. Porn.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The nasty kind. Torture, rape… animals.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sweet kid.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: This is all that's left. One box in the bottom of a closet.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: Ohh. He used to wear those stupid things all the time. Used to have to pretend I was scared.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Made in the People's Republic of Lead Paint.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: Back door.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let's get out of here first. We need to catch the end of our class.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: I met him at school. He was the only boy that liked me.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: It's a little more than like.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: We haven't had sex.

utterance.speaker: Fay
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Iris. You're pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: So I'm just lying about everything?

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Well, you lied about the boyfriend. You obviously lied about sex and this… garbage.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: They're his. He can't keep them at his place.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Well, I'm glad we could be so accommodating. What else don't I know? Honey… what is it?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: He came here last night. And he told me I should leave. But I didn't want to, and he got mad.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: He hit you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Physical trauma.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Explains the negatives of the blood disorder.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: We should call the police.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: I won't tell them anything.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: That's ridiculous. He beat you!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: It's getting hard to see. What the hell is happening to me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rubbing alcohol, vinegar. Not sure what this is.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: Aren't there actual medical tests?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dead patients usually get a lower standard of care. Pink means lead. Orange means mercury. And rust means arsenic.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: And what's brown mean?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Scotch.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: He used to call him "Deezer." He couldn't say "zebra." He'd have his own words for everything. We called 'em "Drewisms."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How does your ex-wife do it? How come she's not… angry and miserable?

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: She treated it like it never happened. She never even cried. Not even at his funeral. I was a mess, and she just sat there like… a statue.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We have a problem.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Does it limp?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why do you care if he works on two cases?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 'Cause next, it'll be three cases, then four. Then animal cases and ghost cases. Then animal ghost cases. Assuming, of course, we are talking about House.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're just setting yourself up to fail.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He has a lot more to lose than I do, and he knows that. He's rational.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, he's not.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's the most rational man I've ever met. Annoyingly so. He isn't gonna put himself back in jail over a dead kid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's an addict, and he will put himself back in jail over a puzzle.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He'll back down.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Halfway through the perimetry exam, her tunnel vision went away. She can see perfectly.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: TIA. The word "transient" is right there in the name.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ah, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Chesa, after giving the pics an eye or two, I can confirm that Lauren's surgeries cost her some big bikkies. Not only was there a gut tuck, nose tuck, and arse tuck, but her new, fake norks stick out like nuts on a mutt.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The original script was…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shh, shh, shh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Anyone notice…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's enlightening us.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's 'cause he's retooled the ol' todger. Let's just hope no one cut the wrong wire, eh?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So you just wanted to look pretty on TV.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Question is, why did he want that? Clinic time.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: MRA 4 TIA. ROFL.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Thought you only had clinic on Tuesdays.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you're right.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Hi. I'm here for the free flu shot. I got a call saying…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm here to find out why you didn't care about your first kid. Losing a child… just breezed right through it.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: How do you know about my first kid…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't even squeeze out a single tear at the funeral.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Where are you getting this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You couldn't wait to squeeze out a brand-new replacement kid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: You had no right to say that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. I deserved the slap. But I was hoping that you weren't capable of it. Apathetic hyperthyroidism. Could have kidney involvement. Could be genetic. Definitely causes apathy. I was hoping that your lack of emotion was a symptom of something you could have passed on to your first son.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: You know Emory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We belong to the same club.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: He wants to relive this. I don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So I heard.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Emory was a wonderful man. Never afraid to show his emotions. Which is great, most of the time. But when Drew died… it overwhelmed him. I vowed I wouldn't let that happen to me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So that's why you left him?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I left because of his eyes. He had Drew's eyes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who used to babysit Drew?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: My father, but…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His place or yours?

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: There are two types of people. Those who can move on, and those who can't. My father keeps up a good front, but he's just like Emory. You need to leave him alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So he has two types of people inside of him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: MRA was normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, how did…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I found out where your boyfriend lives. When I paid him a visit, he took off. Ran in front of a car.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's down in the E.R. right now.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Shut up, you lying sack of crap.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Iris!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do you know I'm lying? How do you know your boyfriend's okay?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: 'Cause I'm right here, you dick.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Iris has dissociative identity disorder. Also known as multiple personality disorder.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Are you saying I'm crazy?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's the mind's response to a severe trauma. A person experiences something that's too difficult to accept, so they create alternate personalities that don't have to accept it. Some think it's quite a natural reaction.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Iris hasn't had any severe traumas.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The car accident?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: I was two. I don't remember anything. These personalities that I'm supposed to have… Where are they?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They only come out when you're afraid or anxious. That's why House used the hurt boyfriend story.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: But if there's no boyfriend, where did the bruises come from? The pregnancy?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: When you say your boyfriend hit you, it means you actually hit yourself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And the pregnancy… doesn't take a boyfriend, just a boy. You may not be aware of half the things you've done.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: How could this be happening to my own daughter without me knowing it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Diazepam was masking it. Taking her off made it more apparent.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: But I… I wasn't on… "diazepam"? What is that?

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: That's what those vitamin pills were. Iris… I am so sorry. I just… I thought you were moody. I didn't want you to think you needed medication. Oh, my God. I can't believe how stupid I've been.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need you to help us with something. Different alters can he different apparent symptoms. Allergies, paresthesia, vision loss, changes in blood pressure.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Do you think I'm making this up?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your symptoms are real. But some are physiological, and others are psychological.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: So there's something wrong with her… in addition to the multiple personalities?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, but we won't know what until we access her alters and compare their symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Well, how do you do that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hypnosis.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Foreman's not gonna back down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, he is. Just like you. If you keep being stubborn, he will keep being stubborn. Eventually, you will screw something up. Which will be bad news for both of you. But… only one of you will be in prison. It just isn't worth it, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, y-yes, sir. I… yes, I know I told you that I had a chiropractor's appointment, but, uh, I got a flat. I know, right? So… …you know, don't send out the marines. I should be back on the road in a few minutes. Okay bye. Dr. James Wilson, County Coroner. I'd like to ask you about your grandson, Drew Lemaine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did he do when he was here? Where did he play? What did he eat?

utterance.speaker: Grandpa
utterance.content: We watched lot of TV. And ate biscuits.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you give him sidewalk chalk?

utterance.speaker: Grandpa
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Finger paints?

utterance.speaker: Grandpa
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A sandbox?

utterance.speaker: Grandpa
utterance.content: It's like I said. We watched a lotta TV.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You expecting someone?

utterance.speaker: Grandpa
utterance.content: What? Dr. Wilson my ass!

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I told you to leave him alone, you son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Temper trigger.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Who am I talking to now?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Nobody.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You must be somebody.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: I'm too little. Nobody sees me. Nobody knows I'm here.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: BP just went to 140 over 90.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: My arms.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You can't feel them? It's okay. We can fix that. Do you hurt anywhere else?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Not right now.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But you used to hurt?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: When I ate strawberries. And when I remember…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do you remember being hurt?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: I remember everything.

utterance.speaker: Father
utterance.content: Baby… It's going to be okay, baby.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Iris? Why didn't you ever tell me?

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: It was my fault Daddy died.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Oh, no. No.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Yes, it was. I was crying and he couldn't drive. It was my fault daddy's…

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Oh, no. No, no, honey.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: You were just a baby. It wasn't your fault. No, shh. Oh, baby.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: It was my fault. I'm sorry, Mommy.

utterance.speaker: Faye
utterance.content: Shh.

utterance.speaker: Iris
utterance.content: I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It wasn't a miscarriage. Test shows she's still pregnant. Okay, cross out everything that doesn't appear in every alter.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When she opened the Magic 8 Ball, that triggered a switch to a personality with a strawberry allergy.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Pregnancy, vaginal bleeding, and elevated B.P.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Could be pre-eclampsia.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Worst case, could be an ectopic pregnancy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Not seeing an embryo in the fallopian tube.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not seeing an embryo anywhere.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which idiot did the pregnancy test?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I did one of them. Chase did another. Taub did a third. Three tests, three positives. What happened to your eye?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I grabbed Park's ass. Exoplanets.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think he said exoplanets.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wait for it…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We can't actually see them… but we infer their existence because of the effect they have on the star they orbit.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pregnancy test only infers an embryo's existence because of elevated hCG levels.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Which could also be caused by choriocarcinoma, which affects the placenta, mimics pregnancy, and causes elevated BP and vaginal bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Occult choriocarcinoma, which is why we didn't see it on the ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell all the alters that they have cancer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Mom or dad?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mom, dad, and mom's dad. The good news is, made me realize that you were right. I can't drop it. But now that I accept that, I feel much less conflicted. I've ruled out Wegener's, Berger's, heavy metal poison…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Two trains are about to collide, and I'm trying to talk them out of it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Feels like I'm missing something.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, no. You don't want to listen to me, then I don't want to listen to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is so fifth grade.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I agree. And you know why? Because I'm just as bad as you. I knew this would fall on deaf ears, but I just kept talking and talking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't even know what I just said.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is ridiculous. You said, "blah blah blah blah blah, deaf ears, blah blah blah blah blah." Absolutely essential information.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Ray… Ray! Leave him alone. What are you doing to him? It's okay.

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: Mickey…

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: You? You brought him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I asked him to meet me here for a family reunion.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Ray!

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: Let's just get out of here, okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know what killed your son.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: You don't get it, do you? I don't care what killed him!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's called Alport syndrome. It's a genetic condition characterized by kidney failure, bronchial myomas, Mees' lines, and deafness.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: Idiot. Drew wasn't deaf!

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: House…

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Son of a bitch! Get away from them!

utterance.speaker: Emory
utterance.content: House, House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a genetic condition!

utterance.speaker: Ray
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Genetic! Your father has the gene. So do you. It's grandpa's slight deafness that gave the game away. You're apparently asymptomatic. You could still pass the gene onto your children. Plural.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He has high-frequency hearing impairment. And so did Drew. That's why Drew made up his own words. 'Cause he couldn't hear properly. It's okay. Now that we know what it is, he'll need treatment, but he'll live. There are platitudes that can help you with that.

utterance.speaker: Mickey
utterance.content: I miss him too.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: She's responding well.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cuddy threatened him with clinic duty. I thought threatening him with jail would be different.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not an irrational thought.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm still sending him back.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He saved two lives.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which means it's too late for me to back down. It's no longer my choice. It's just me telling him he can get away with anything. I have to send him to prison.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your job is to keep this machine running. It's your choice to make House a useful tool or a monkey wrench. Cuddy's way didn't fail because she didn't try to control House. She managed him. She knew better than anybody what a tool he could be.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What would Cuddy have done?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ten clinic hours.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cuddy's not here anymore. You got 30.
